author: PatrickFB
body:
<!--

If it is a bug report:
- make sure you are able to repro it on the latest released version. 
You can install the latest version from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](../docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](../docs/KNOWNISSUES.md).
- Fill out the following repro template

If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->

Steps to reproduce
------------------
```powershell
C:\PS> Get-Date > Date.tmp
C:\PS> New-FileCatalog -CatalogVersion 2 -CatalogFilePath catalog.cat -Path Date.tmp -WhatIf
```

Expected behavior
-----------------

```powershell
What if: Performing the operation "Create new file catalog" on target "C:\PS\catalog.cat".
```

Actual behavior
---------------
```powershell
Mode          LastWriteTime Length Name       
----          ------------- ------ ----       
-a----  12/9/2016  12:37 PM    433 catalog.cat
```

You can see the file has been created. 
The Hash is also being calculated too. 

```powershell
C:\PS> Test-FileCatalog -Detailed -CatalogFilePath catalog.cat 

Status        : Valid
HashAlgorithm : SHA256
CatalogItems  : {[Date.tmp, 2F38E0FD77AF90E6E463938C4D4ED9AE03F575AC7C0441C6A3DBE9A1C4D55459]}
PathItems     : {[Date.tmp, 2F38E0FD77AF90E6E463938C4D4ED9AE03F575AC7C0441C6A3DBE9A1C4D55459]}
Signature     : System.Management.Automation.Signature

C:\PS> Get-FileHash -Path Date.tmp

Algorithm : SHA256
Hash      : 2F38E0FD77AF90E6E463938C4D4ED9AE03F575AC7C0441C6A3DBE9A1C4D55459
Path      : C:\Temp\Demo\Date.tmp

```

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
> $PSVersionTable

Name                      Value                  
----                      -----                  
PSVersion                 5.1.14393.206          
PSEdition                 Desktop                
PSCompatibleVersions      {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
BuildVersion              10.0.14393.206         
CLRVersion                4.0.30319.42000        
WSManStackVersion         3.0                    
PSRemotingProtocolVersion 2.3                    
SerializationVersion      1.1.0.1                

```

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @PatrickFB Could you make the test with the latest build Powershell 6.0?

comments.author: kittholland
comments.body:
I was able to reproduce based on his steps.

```
Name                           Value
----                           -----
BuildVersion                   3.0.0.0
PSVersion                      6.0.0-alpha
CLRVersion
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-alpha.13-37-gbbf1766ac7e82d301346e477dcab85721395be1d
PSEdition                      Core
WSManStackVersion              3.0
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
```

```
PS C:\temp\catalogtest> get-date | Out-File date.tmp
PS C:\temp\catalogtest> New-FileCatalog -CatalogVersion 2 -CatalogFilePath catalog.cat -Path Date.tmp -WhatIf

Mode                LastWriteTime         Length Name
----                -------------         ------ ----
-a----        12/9/2016   2:28 PM            433 catalog.cat


PS C:\temp\catalogtest>  Test-FileCatalog -Detailed -CatalogFilePath catalog.cat


Status        : Valid
HashAlgorithm : SHA256
CatalogItems  : {[Date.tmp, 9DC50C439A67C3C563925DAA3BB8B1C732D990DC9D798E0FED02F102114CAA50]}
PathItems     : {[date.tmp, 9DC50C439A67C3C563925DAA3BB8B1C732D990DC9D798E0FED02F102114CAA50]}
Signature     : System.Management.Automation.Signature
```

comments.author: MarekZietek
comments.body:
https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/5d54f1aa3871a826409496437e25856dc263ccc4/src/Microsoft.PowerShell.Security/security/CatalogCommands.cs#L117-L120

There already exists a call to ShouldProcess in CatalogCommands.cs. Apparently the reason that it doesn't work is that it calls the 1-parameter function and not the 2-parameter one. This is weird because both methods should do the same thing but they don't. Adding a second parameter action fixes it.

Is this expected behavior for the single parameter method to return true when what if is specified?

title: New-FileCatalog ignores -WhatIf
